com.mobixell.xtt
Class FunctionModule_SMS

java.lang.Object
  com.mobixell.xtt.FunctionModule
      com.mobixell.xtt.FunctionModule_SMS
All Implemented Interfaces:
MMSConstants, Comparable<Object>
public class FunctionModule_SMS
extends FunctionModule
implements MMSConstants

FunctionModule_SMS provides SMSCenter and SMS send functions.

startSMSCServer

public boolean startSMSCServer(String[] parameters)
starts the SMSCServer as an instance of SMSCServer.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name,
parameters[1] argument is the SMSCServer port,
parameters[2] is the SMSCServer protocolle (SMPP/UCP).
If UCP is used the following additional parameters can be used:
parameters[3] argument is the maxrequestcount before disconnecting (-1=default, unlimited).
parameters[4] argument is UCP Window size possible (1=default).
parameters[5] argument is UCP response delay in ms for each request (0=default).
parameters[6] argument is UCP maximum open sessions on the server (0=default, unlimited).
parameters[7] argument is UCP maximum open connections to the server (0=default, unlimited).
parameters[8] argument is UCP session timeout in ms on the server (0=default, unlimited).
parameters[9] argument is UCP read timeout in ms on the server (0=default, unlimited).
Additionally there can be:
parameters[10] argument means that injectAutoMessages is enabled and for each UCP51 an UCP53 will begenerated
parameters[11] argument is earliestAutoMessageSendTime in ms before sending the automatic message (0=default no delay).
parameters[12] argument is latestAutoMessageSendTime in ms before sending the automatic message (use earliestAutoMessageSendTime or bigger).
parameters[13] argument is autoMessageRetryTime in ms is how long the smsc waits on a connection for data before checking if it has to send out auto message (500=default).

If only parameters[0] is submitted earliestAutoMessageSendTime latestAutoMessageSendTime autoMessageRetryTime the parameters will be taken from the configuration xml document in XTTProperties. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
SMSCServer, XTTProperties

stopSMSCServer

public boolean stopSMSCServer(String[] parameters)
stops one/all SMSCServers and all it's threads.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, no additional parameters are requeired, the optional parameters[1] argument is the SMSCServer port of the SMSCServer to stop, if omitted all running servers are stopped. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
SMSCServer.closeSocket(String), SMSCServer.closeSockets()

waitForBind

public boolean waitForBind(String[] parameters)
wait for a SMPP Bind or an UCP60 message on the SMSC.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, no additional parameters are requeired , the optional parameters[1] argument can be an ipaddress from which the connection is made OR it can be a systemId(SMPP) or OAdC(UCP). If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
UCPWorker.waitForBind(), UCPWorker.waitForBind(java.net.InetAddress), UCPWorker.waitForBind(String), SMPPWorker.waitForBind(), SMPPWorker.waitForBind(java.net.InetAddress), SMPPWorker.waitForBind(String), CIMDWorker.waitForBind(), CIMDWorker.waitForBind(java.net.InetAddress), CIMDWorker.waitForBind(String)

setSMSCPassword

public void setSMSCPassword(String[] parameters)
set the password for SMPP and UCP on the SMSCServer

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, no additional parameters resets the password , the parameters[1] argument sets the UCP and SMPP password to this value. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
UCPWorker.waitForMessage(String), SMPPWorker.waitForMessage(String)

waitForMessage

public boolean waitForMessage(String[] parameters)
wait for a SMPP or an UCP message on the SMSCServer

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, no additional parameters are requeired , the optional parameters[1] argument can be a systemId(SMPP) or OAdC(UCP). If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
UCPWorker.waitForMessage(String), SMPPWorker.waitForMessage(String)

waitForWSPMessages

public boolean waitForWSPMessages(String[] parameters)
wait for a WSP message on the SMSCServer (SMPP or UCP)

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument is the number of messages received total since starting the SMSCServer If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
UCPWorker.waitForWSPMessages(int), SMPPWorker.waitForWSPMessages(int)

wait for a messages on the SMSCServer (SMPP or UCP or CIMD) (except bind)

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument is the number of messages received total since starting the SMSCServer If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

waitForTimeoutWSPMessages

public boolean waitForTimeoutWSPMessages(String[] parameters)
wait for a NO WSP message on the SMSCServer (SMPP or UCP)

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument is the amount of time in ms to wait befor timing out with no message (success) parameters[2] argument is the maximum number of messages that may already have been received If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
UCPWorker.waitForTimeoutWSPMessages(int,int), SMPPWorker.waitForTimeoutWSPMessages(int,int)

public void setOverrideReturnCode(String[] parameters)

parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, no additional parameters resets the password , the parameters[1] argument sets the UCP and SMPP password to this value. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
UCPWorker.setOverrideReturnCode(int,int), SMPPWorker.setOverrideReturnCode(int,int)

wait for a NO WSP message on the SMSCServer (SMPP or UCP)

Parameters:

sendGetRequest

public void sendGetRequest(String[] parameters)
starts the SMSCServer as an instance of SMSCServer. The method also automatically sets the Accpet, User-Agent and host headers. Returned data is decoded as MMS and stored in SMS/[msisdn].

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument is the msisdn for the x-msisdn header, parameters[2] is the url, parameters[3] is the User-Agent. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
MMSDecoder

checkResponseCode

public void checkResponseCode(String[] parameters)
compare the http response code of the last POST/GET request with a value.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument is the post field name, parameters[2] argument and following are concatenated together to the header value. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

setNextMessageDelay

public void setNextMessageDelay(String[] parameters)
Set a edelay for the SMSC befroe reading the next message. This should give time to check the recieved data before the next message arrives.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument is delay time in miliseconds, If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
MMSDecoder

decodeMM1Packet

createMM1Packet

public void createMM1Packet(String[] parameters)
Create an MM1 package.
Allowed Parameters, generic format:
name
name messageType moreOptions...
Allowed Parameters, more specific format:
name M_SEND_REQ transactionID mmsVersion toAddress contentType
name M_SEND_REQ transactionID mmsVersion toAddress contentType contentTypeCharset
name M_SEND_REQ transactionID mmsVersion toAddress contentType contentTypeMultipartType contentTypeMultipartStart
name M_SEND_CONF transactionID mmsVersion responseStatus
name M_NOTIFICATION_IND transactionID mmsVersion messageClass messageSize expiryIsAbsolute expiryDate contentLocation
name M_NOTIFYRESP_IND transactionID mmsVersion
name M_RETRIEVE_CONF mmsVersion date contentType
name M_RETRIEVE_CONF mmsVersion date contentType contentTypeCharset
name M_RETRIEVE_CONF mmsVersion date contentType contentTypeMultipartType contentTypeMultipartStart
name M_ACKNOWLEDGE_IND mmsVersion
name M_DELIVERY_IND mmsVersion messageID toAddress dateTime mmStatus
name M_READ_REC_IND mmsVersion toAddress fromAddress messageID readStatus
name M_READ_ORIG_IND mmsVersion toAddress fromAddress messageID dateTime readStatus
name M_FORWARD_REQ transactionID mmsVersion toAddress contentLocation
name M_FORWARD_CONF transactionID mmsVersion responseStatus messageID

For more information on allowed Optional and Mandatory parameters
see Multimedia Messaging Service Encapsulation Protocol Candidate Version 1.3 27 Sep 2005 (OMA-TS-MMS-ENC-V1_3-20050927-C.pdf)
see 3GPP TS 23.140 V6.12.0 2006-03 (23140-6c0.doc)
see Wireless Application Protocol, Wireless Session Protocol Specification, Approved Version 5-July-2001 (WAP-230-WSP-20010705-a.pdf)

setAdditionalHeader

public void setAdditionalHeader(String[] parameters)
set the addtional headers to be sent in MM1 Request

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters.
parameters[0] argument is always the method name,
parameters[1] is headerkey
parameters[2] is headervalue
parameters -

createMM1PacketContentType

public void createMM1PacketContentType(String[] parameters)
Set the MM1 packet content type header on a packet. The content-type header will always be the LAST header sent if set this way (or when using the createMM1Packet with content-type as mandatory header).

createMM1PacketOptions

public void createMM1PacketOptions(String[] parameters)
Add optional/conditional headers to the MM1 packet. encoded String format not yet supported, used text-string instead. only headerType and boolean can be added as text values at te momment. use numeric values for now.

For more information on allowed Optional and Mandatory parameters
see Multimedia Messaging Service Encapsulation Protocol Candidate Version 1.3 27 Sep 2005 (OMA-TS-MMS-ENC-V1_3-20050927-C.pdf)
see 3GPP TS 23.140 V6.12.0 2006-03 (23140-6c0.doc)
see Wireless Application Protocol, Wireless Session Protocol Specification, Approved Version 5-July-2001 (WAP-230-WSP-20010705-a.pdf)

public void clearMM1PacketOptions(String[] parameters)
